title: Billboard for Terminator Dark Fate sparks fury after it was erected outside an ABORTION CLINIC
text:
An billboard advertisement for the upcoming Terminator: Dark Fate movie has sparked fury after it was erected outside an abortion clinic.

The unfortunately-placed sign was set up at the Marie Stopes Bowen Hills Day Surgery in Brisbane's inner-city.

Staff at the surgery have now hit out at the inappropriate placement of the sign and are working to have it removed.

An billboard advertisement for the upcoming Terminator: Dark Fate movie has sparked fury after it was erected outside an abortion clinic

'It was through our staff we started to make inquiries to get it removed,' a spokesman for Marie Stopes told Daily Mail Australia.

'It's unfortunate and obviously inappropriate.'

An image of the sign was first posted to Reddit on Friday afternoon.

The spokesman said the sign had likely 'not been there for long'.

Marie Stopes said they would release a full statement on the issue once they had completed their investigation into its presence.

Terminator: Dark Fate, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and James Cameron, will be released in Australian cinemas on October 31.

Abortion was decriminalised in Queensland October 2018 and women can access termination services on request up to 22 weeks into their pregnancy.
description: The unfortunately-placed large rectangular sign was set up at the Marie Stopes Bowen Hills Day Surgery in Brisbane's inner-city and  staff at the surgery have now hit out at the inappropriate placement.
authors: Charlie Coë For Daily Mail Australia
